meanings.definition: Capable of annihilating or destroying completely.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's annihilatory powers could obliterate any enemy in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The bomb had an annihilatory impact on the entire city, leaving nothing but ruins.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's tantrum had an annihilatory effect on the neatly arranged toys in the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm's winds were so annihilatory, they swept away everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread with an annihilatory speed, infecting the entire population within days.

meanings.sent1: The scientist's experiment had an annihilatory outcome, leading to the destruction of the lab.
meanings.sent2: The war had an annihilatory effect on the country, leaving it in ruins.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt at a new recipe had an unexpectedly annihilatory result.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake's force was so annihilatory, it leveled the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The dictator's reign was marked by an annihilatory approach to dissent, silencing all opposition.

meanings.sent1: The aggressive dog had an annihilatory attitude towards any intruders on its territory.
meanings.sent2: The invasive species had an annihilatory impact on the local ecosystem, disrupting the balance.
meanings.sent3: The student's procrastination habits had an annihilatory effect on his academic performance.
meanings.sent4: The company's cost-cutting measures had an annihilatory effect on employee morale.
meanings.sent5: The dictator's policies were annihilatory, leading to widespread suffering among the population.
